title: Project-Based Instructional Design (ID) Competency Assessment and Development Program Linked to Elementary Social Studies Curriculum

context.prior_knowledge: Basic curriculum design knowledge, learning theory comprehension, digital tool proficiency, and elementary social studies curriculum (history/geography/economics) concept understanding
context.additional_context: Aims to cultivate in-house educational technology experts for elementary school settings. Emphasis on utilizing assessment tools based on the IBSTPI competency framework and designing projects linked to social studies (culture, politics, civic rights).

learning_goals: Learners achieve 80% or higher on IBSTPI evaluation and performance competency standards, strengthening their PBL design skills linked to social studies.
Learners complete three or more PBL projects reflecting real elementary social studies environments (history, geography, culture).
Learners improve design prototypes incorporating civic education elements at least twice through peer assessment.
Learners write a learning outcome analysis report using digital tools and propose improvements to the educational system.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
